issues.description: The `messageOnMilk()` method is specified in the problem statement and UML to return a `String` (e.g., "Seal Clarabelle is milked"), but in the solution repository the `Milkable` interface and its implementations use `boolean messageOnMilk()`. This mismatch in return type will confuse students and prevent them from implementing the correct design.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the signature of `messageOnMilk()` in `Milkable` (and its implementations in `Seal` and `Goat`) to return `String`, and have each implementation return the milk message string instead of returning a boolean.
